page.title: 16BEN NEVIS RACE.
page.content: The Ben Nevis Race is held every year in Claggan Park,Fort William.The race started in the year of 1895 when a barber from Fort William ran up and down the mountain from the old Post Office in 2hrs 41mins.The record is now held by Kenny Stuart.He ran for Keswick AC and his time was 1hr 25mins 34secs in 1984.The race was posponed in 1980 because of bad weather conditions.In 1984 Pauline Howarth of Keswick broke the lady's record with a time of 1hr 43 min 25 sec.Eddie Campbell of Lochaber A.C. has run 35 times. In 1985 there were over 500 runners. The major sponsor for the last four years has been Long John International Ltd.
